page.title: 01Gazateer: grid ref.04600270
page.content: These twelve grid squares are situated to the north west of Northampton. The main centre of population is the village of West Haddon. In the 1981 Census the population of West Haddon is given as 852 persons. The village is situated at the junction of the A428, the main Rugby to Northampton road, and the B4036, the route from Daventry to Market Harborough.It is characterised by a wide variety of house styles reflecting the development of the village, availability and cost of materials, and fashion. The area is distinctly rural and the land cover is farmland. There is little locally based employment and most residents commute to Daventry, Rugby, Northampton, or more distant places for their work.
